resources.string: Is Java an Object-Oriented Language\nYes or No?

string-array.name: question1
string-array.item: [B] The memory address of the allocated memory of btn.

string-array.name: question2
string-array.item: 2. What is the correct syntax for declaring XML version?

string-array.name: question3
string-array.item: 3. What is the keyword to create a subclass in Java?

string-array.name: question4
string-array.item: 4. What does the * denote in Regular Expressions?
[B] Match 1 or more of the preceding.
[D] Match 0 or more of the preceding.

string-array.name: question5
string-array.item: 5. How do you refer to the current object inside a Java class?

string-array.name: question6
string-array.item:
6. The Mammal class inherits the Animal class.
The Lion class inherits the Mammal class.
The Reptile class inherits the Animal class
The Lizard class inherits the Reptile class
The Tiger class inherits the Mammal class
What is true about ArrayList<Mammal>?
[A] It can contain objects of the Mammal class.
[B] It can contain objects of the Lion class.
[C] It can contain objects of the Tiger class.
[D] It cannot contain objects of the Snake class.

string-array.name: question7
string-array.item: 7. What attribute would you add to make the width of a Button only as wide as what it contains? (in XML)

string-array.name: question8
string-array.item: 8. What is the keyword to access the methods of the parent class in Java?

string-array.name: question9
string-array.item: 9. Which of the following best describes the difference between an object and a class in Java?
[B] Classes are code, objects are memory.
[C] Classes are written in Java, objects are written in XML.
[D] Classes have methods, objects do not.
[E] Classes exist at runtime, object do not.

string-array.name: question10
string-array.item: 10. How many methods are in the View.onClickListener interface?
